Ash Williams.Action: Plays the waltz music on the piano for Linda; refers to it as 'our song.'
Plays the piano poorly, only able to plunk out the melody with two fingers.
Attempts to play and engage Linda by playing the waltz music, showing confidence in social interaction despite lack of musical skill.
Pulls Linda close, returns her loving stare, and shares a sincere, intimate dance.
Smiles to comfort Linda when she takes his hand, showing reassurance.
Kills possessed Linda by beheading her with a shovel to protect himself.
Destroys the Book of the Dead by tossing it into the fire, attempting to stop the evil.
Buries Linda's headless body with a crude wooden cross, showing intention but minimal ritual skill.
Runs from the grave site toward the cabin without any apparent plan or strategy shown.
Wipes mud and blood from his face with a rag while driving, showing focus on self-care before assessing the situation.
Steps quietly from the car and carefully examines the dangerous bridge, indicating caution and respect for his environment.
Runs desperately toward the cabin despite being pursued and injured (face cut and bleeding).
Shakes his head 'No' while running, indicating rejection or refusal.
Remembers and mourns Linda by holding her locket and recognizing the music associated with her, showing his sadness and emotional connection.
Awakens suddenly, senses danger, and clutches his shotgun while moving cautiously toward the source of unusual music.
Recognizes the haunting piano music as the same melody he had played earlier, showing awareness and connection to past events.
Removes Linda's locket and looks mournfully into the magnifying glass, showing emotional distraction amidst a tense situation.
Screams and shows visible fear when confronted by the undead Linda, struggles to regain control of himself.
Attempts to reassure himself verbally despite terrifying hallucination, indicating vulnerability and a need for sanity.
Screams in pain and distress as Linda's head bites his hand; tries to rid himself of the possessed head.
Places Linda's severed head in a vice and tightens it despite her pleas, showing determination to separate himself from the evil.
Fights the headless body of Linda with a crowbar, despite emotional turmoil.
Rushing around the cabin screaming while trying to remove the head biting his hand.
Kicks open the door to the work shed despite injury and pursues a solution.
Places the biting head in a vice to stop it from causing more harm.
Notices the missing chainsaw and looks confused, showing uncertainty in the situation.
Grabs a crowbar and attempts to defend himself against the charging hostile body.
Dislodges the chainsaw from possessed Linda and prepares to kill her to end her suffering despite his feelings.
Faltering and struggling emotionally at the moment of hurting Linda, showing sensitivity and conflict.
Agonizes and screams in fear and despair after killing possessed Linda, showing emotional vulnerability and inner conflict.
Moves to kill possessed Linda with a chainsaw despite emotional anguish, aiming to stop the demon and protect others.
Gains control of himself amidst a horrifying and emotional situation, steadies his chainsaw, and decisively attacks the demon-possessed Linda's head with the chainsaw.
After the violent act, he stumbles back, trembling in shock and despair, fails to immediately regain composure, and reacts with fear rather than strategic focus.
Clutches the chainsaw for protection and cautiously approaches a creaking sound in the cabin, showing fear but also trying to confront the unknown threat.
Attempts to reassure himself by looking in the mirror and repeating "I'm fine... I'm fine...", revealing his vulnerability and a sincere moment of self-encouragement.
Clutches the chainsaw again, prepares cautiously by picking up the gun before entering the room with a strange noise.
Moves slowly and cautiously toward the source of the noise, showing awareness and carefulness.
Attempts to stop the rocking chair, showing some bravery but also hesitation and fear.
Begs himself to remain sane while backing away confused, showing uncertainty and diminished confidence.
Self-strangulation in response to guilt over hurting girlfriend, moment of self-awareness and remorse.
Screams at the evil force possessing his hand, showing desperation and frustration.
Mumbles reassurances to himself in disbelief and distress.
Fights against his possessed hand despite pain and injury.
Fights back aggressively against the attacking demon hand, ultimately reviving and wielding a chainsaw to defend himself.
Ash revives himself just in time to stop the demon hand from grabbing a meat cleaver, showcasing alertness and quick reaction.
Uses the chainsaw mounted on his arm effectively to kill the demon hand, demonstrating resourcefulness and skill.
Ash remains unconscious for a significant time while the hand attacks him, indicating vulnerability and temporary loss of control.
Pins the detached evil hand beneath his foot and traps it under an overturned wastebasket, then secures it with a pile of books.
Uses a red hot fireplace shovel to cauterize his own wound to stop bleeding, demonstrating quick thinking and pain tolerance.
Creates a makeshift bandage using a tablecloth and duct tape for his injured wrist.
Fails to maintain constant vigilance leading to the Evil Hand escaping from under the wastebasket unnoticed.
Raises shotgun and fires at the animated hand to protect himself.
Laughs gruffly at the hand caught in the mousetrap.
Throws back his head in a gruff bark of laughter after the hand flips him off.
Raises gun to shoot at the evil hand chasing him, showing readiness to defend himself.
Laughs confidently after trapping the hand, then raises his gun and fires multiple shots at the hand's location.
Lowes the smoking gun wondering if he hit the hand, showing uncertainty about the effectiveness of his attack.
Expresses horror and fear as he is attacked by surging blood and his severed wrist erupts blood, showing vulnerability in a terrifying situation.
In the midst of chaos and supernatural attack, he does not lash out aggressively or cruelly but reacts with fear and confusion.
Withdraws and takes a seated position after being overwhelmed, indicating a non-confrontational and perhaps reflective response.
Is horrified and screams, driven against walls by bursting blood from his severed wrist, ultimately collapsing from shock.
After chaos subsides, he cautiously backs away from walls and sits down, showing some awareness and self-preservation despite fear.
Turns sharply and pays attention to the changing moose head and strange laughter, indicating alertness amidst terror.
Breaks into uproarious laughter along with the animate objects in the cabin, appearing to enjoy the moment with them.
Instantly terrified by the knock at the door, reacts by firing into the door to protect himself without hesitation.
Despite being held down and slugged by Jake, Ash defends himself by landing a punch.
Remains mostly passive while others express concern and fear, no clear caring behavior shown in the excerpt.

Kicks the trapdoor shut, crushing Henrietta's Pee-Wee head, then leaps down and slams the trapdoor to pin her, causing her eyeball to pop out and effectively incapacitating the threat.
Quickly threads chains through the eyeloops and snaps the lock shut on the trapdoor to secure the threat.

Warns group that danger is outside in the woods and insists no one leaves until daylight.
Facilitates group staying together and making cautious decisions despite fear.
Gently halts Annie from unlocking the chains despite her emotional confusion.
Stops Annie from unlocking the chains and potentially releasing a possessed entity, showing caution and protective judgment.
Retreats in horror from the possessed Ed and disappears into the middle bedroom rather than confront the threat.

Clutches an axe confidently in his single hand and approaches possessed Ed to attack.
Successfully slices through the top portion of possessed Ed's head, incapacitating him temporarily.
Stands slowly into frame, knowing that the silence can't be good, indicating awareness of the danger.
Speculates that something is trying to force its way into their world, demonstrating situational understanding.
Holds Annie when she runs to him, showing physical comfort and reassurance.
Nods to Annie in a show of thanks when she volunteers to go with him, acknowledging her support.
Volunteers to enter a potentially dangerous room first and suggests that all go in together, demonstrating protective leadership and inclusiveness.
Moves toward the door decisively, showing courage but possibly a focus on action over dialogue.
Waits silently and attentively as the group is confronted by ominous supernatural events.
Lights the lantern to illuminate the room despite chaos, showing initiative and presence of mind.
His evil hand (a supernatural and difficult-to-control appendage) is uncontrollably clutching Bobby Joe, indirectly causing chaos.
Tells Jake that if Bobby Joe went into the woods, she's not coming back.
Realistically assesses the situation, concluding that Bobby Joe is not coming back from the woods.
Shows concern and hope when Annie finds a potential solution to their problem, indicating he values their efforts and well-being.
Responds skeptically and somewhat sarcastically to Annie's explanation of the passages, showing distrust or dismissiveness.

His competence is not directly demonstrated through skill or confident action in this excerpt, rather through internal emotional conflict; no clear evidence of skillful or intelligent behavior.
Reassures Annie he is all right and tries to stop her attack by telling her to listen, indicating concern and care.
